page.title: 11HOME LIFE Essex/Cambs Border
page.content: Feeding the Family:Most people have one cooked meal a day consisting of a meat or fish dish with potatoes and another vegetable,usually followed by a cooked pudding,fresh fruit or cake. The meat is usually Beef,Lamb,Pork or Chicken. There are a few vegetarians who replace the meat dish with a pulse and nut dish. Many people have this meal in the evening as they are out all day. The exceptions being farmers and the elderly who have it at noon. The majority don't eat cooked break- fast but eat toast and cereals. Tea,coffee and soft drinks are the most common beverages. Most people have a deep-freeze which has greatly enlarged the varieties of foods eaten throughout the year.
